'''Edrahil''' was an [[Elves of Nargothrond|Elf of Nargothrond]].

== History ==
Edrahil was the chief of the ten [[Elves]] who remained loyal to [[Finrod|Finrod Felagund]] at the time he set out with [[Beren]] on the [[Quest for the Silmaril]]. He was the one who lifted Finrod's cast-down crown and asked that it be given to a steward until the king returned. Later he died in the dungeons of [[Tol-in-Gaurhoth]], devoured by a [[werewolf]], alongside his companions.<ref>{{S|Beren}}</ref><ref>{{GA|465}}, paragraphs 193 and 198, pp. 65-6</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Edrahil'' is [[Sindarin]] and not explicitly defined.<ref name=Paul>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2886836973.html|articlename=S. ''Edrahil'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=07 July 2023}}</ref> Of the constituent elements, ''edra'' is a Sindarin verb meaning meaning "open (out)",<ref name="pe17">{{PE|17}}</ref>{{rp|45}} while ''hil'' is frequent in Sindarin in words pertaining to "follow", derived from the [[sundocarme|root]] [[KHIL]]<ref name="pe17"/>{{rp|18}}

According to an earlier version of the [[legendarium]], the character's name was ''Enedrion'',<ref>{{LR|Quenta}}, ''Of Beren and Tinúviel'', entry '''Edrahil''', p. 300</ref> a [[Noldorin]] also not explicitly defined.<ref name=Paul/> Of the constituent elements, ''ened'' means "centre"<ref>{{VT|41}}</ref>{{rp|16}} and ''-[[ion]]'' is a common masculine suffix for "son of".
